Due to the on-going impact the COVID 19 situation is having on NYS finances, the information provided to schools on state aid is constantly changing. Â As aÂ result, the annual Community Budget Meeting, originally scheduled for April 15th, 2020, has been postponed at this time. Â It is our hope to reschedule the meeting in the future. Â Please continue to visit our website for updates Â

td.a: April 6th and 7th message from Mrs. Wenck
td.br:
April 6 and 7, 2020
Good evening,
Â Â Â Â Â Â I hope this email finds you well and enjoying a bit of pleasant April weather. Please read all of the following as it contains several important pieces of information:
* School Closure: While we are waiting for further clarification, we believe the Governor hasÂ extended the closure schools up to April 29th, meaning that as of today, we are to come back toÂ school on Wednesday, April 29th.Â There is some discrepancy on whether the 29thÂ or the 30th is theÂ correct date. Once we have clarification, we will be sure let you know. (This decision continuesÂ the Governor's present extension process of closing 2 weeks at a time.)
* Regents Exams: The NYS Board of Regents has canceled all Regents exams. They made a more formalÂ and complete announcement today while also providing school districts with additional guidance onÂ this matter and how to assess students in these courses.Â As we learn more, it will be shared withÂ you.
*Â Instructional Packets: The 2nd round of packets for grades K-6 have been organized and madeÂ ready for distribution.Â We will be distributing the packets "officially" on Thursday, April 9thÂ via our regular bus routes. The buses will leave the school with the packets 3 hours later than theÂ normal student pickup time; meaning that if a students' normal pick up time is 7:30am, the bus willÂ be at their home at 10:30am. Students need to be outside at this new time with their firstÂ instructional packet. The packet needs to be completed and in the original envelope. If you lostÂ the envelope, place the instructional materials in a sealed bag.
Students will place the first packet in a tote that will be on the bus steps. They will then beÂ handed their second instructional packet. The material in the first packet will be brought to theÂ school for review by each studentâs teacher.
If you would prefer, starting on Wednesday, you can drop off the first packet and pick up theÂ second packet the school from 8:00am â 1:00pm.Â Come to the main office to do so.
If you are a student who walks to school, you can come to get your packet starting on Wednesday asÂ well, or walkers can come to the school on Thursday from 8:00am - 1:00pm to pick up their packet.
Also, for students living in the Valley Stream Trailer park, a bus will be at the front of the parkÂ at 11:00am on Thursday for the exchange of packets.
*Â Â USB drives and Devices:Â Included in some packets, for students in grades 7-12, will be USBÂ drives as was indicated as a need by the student to their teachers. Students having no or poorÂ internet will be provided with the drives which will contain information from their teachers forÂ classes.Â These students do not have access to on-line learning so many teachers are video and/or audio taping their classes to provide instruction.
In addition, some of our students do not have devices/laptops at home to use to complete their work. Again, we have surveyed students in an attempt to gather this information. If your child has been identified as a student that needs a device you will be contacted by the school. Parents will need to come to the building to sign out the device. Before doing so you will need to sign a waiver form indicating your willingness to be responsible for the device and for replacement costs if the device is lost or damaged in any way. Please come to the school on Thursday to do this.
In closing, I know this is a lot of information and a lot of change. Our country has been through a lot in this and the last century, but nothing quite like this. I am confident we will make it through this pandemic and be all the stronger for it.
Take Care, Stay Well.
Mrs. Wenck
Â
Read More...

td.a: Special BOE meeting 7:30 MPR Wednesday, April 8 2020
td.br:
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â LAURENS CENTRAL SCHOOLÂ
SPECIAL MEETING OF THE BOARD OF EDUCATION WEDNESDAY, APRIL 8, 2020 7:30 P.M.
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â MULTIPURPOSE ROOMÂ
Â
For the Purpose of:
1.Â Â Â Â Approving the BOCES Administrative Budget
2.Â Â Â Â The election of BOCES Board members as required by New York State
Â
*Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic and Executive Orders by the Governor of New York State regarding gatherings of more than 10 people, the public will NOT be permitted to attend in person.
*The live meeting will be available remotely to the public via Zoom.Â Please click on the link below and then follow any instructions to join the meeting. https://E2CCB-GST.zoom.us/j/861440443
*There will be no public comment period during the special meeting.Â Once the regular portion of the meeting has concluded the Board of Education will move to enter Executive Session for the following purposes:
1.Â Financial
2.Â Negotiations
Â
If you are unable to join the live meeting there will be a recording and transcript of the open portion of the meeting available on the schoolâs web site on the âBoard of Educationâ page as soon as possible.Â Â
